citations.narrative:
The open dish type feeder in one cage containing one rabbit was covered in a layer of dried bird feces. Food dishes and
food provided must be kept clean and free of contamination to provide clean, wholesome, and palatable food to the
animals. Correct by ensuring rabbit food receptacles are kept clean and sanitized at least every two weeks.
To be corrected by 1/25/2024.

Three cages containing 5 rabbits had mounds of fecal material buildup in the corners and on the mesh floor. Primary
enclosures must be kept free of feces and debris, which may harbor parasites and bacteria in order to provide the animal
with a clean-living environment and prevent exposure to disease hazards. Additionally, the enclosures must be sanitized
at least every 30 days in accordance with 3.56(b). Correct by ensuring the primary enclosures are cleaned at a frequency
that will prevent the build-up of fecal material and debris.
To be corrected by 1/25/2024.

On Nov. 15, 2023, a shelf in the 1-year-old female “Kiki” the kinkajou’s enclosure became unattached, crushing and
trapping the kinkajou underneath it. The kinkajou was transported to the attending veterinarian’s office but died of its
injuries while in transit.
“Ceasar”, the 5-year-old Male Bactrian camel was found dead in its pen entrapped beneath the corner of the metal sided
shed in its enclosure around 7 am on Dec. 11, 2023. The camel had been last seen up and normal at approximately 9 pm
the night before.
Failure of structures or their components can cause injury or entrapment resulting in harm or death to the animal. Both
indoor and outdoor housing facilities must be soundly constructed and maintained in good repair and strength to protect
and contain the animals and to prevent injury due to their failure.
To be corrected by 2/1/2024.
The death of a white wallaby joey purchased on 7/12/23 and found deceased on 7/15/23 is under review.
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with facility representative.
n

narrative:
3.54(b) 
   
Feeding. 
The open dish type feeder in one cage containing one rabbit was covered in a layer of dried bird feces. Food dishes and 
food provided must be kept clean and free of contamination to provide clean, wholesome, and palatable food to the 
animals. Correct by ensuring rabbit food receptacles are kept clean and sanitized at least every two weeks.  
To be corrected by 1/25/2024. 
3.56(a)(1) 
   
Sanitation. 
Three cages containing 5 rabbits had mounds of fecal material buildup in the corners and on the mesh floor. Primary 
enclosures must be kept free of feces and debris, which may harbor parasites and bacteria in order to provide the animal 
with a clean-living environment and prevent exposure to disease hazards. Additionally, the enclosures must be sanitized 
at least every 30 days in accordance with 3.56(b). Correct by ensuring the primary enclosures are cleaned at a frequency 
that will prevent the build-up of fecal material and debris.  
 
To be corrected by 1/25/2024. 
3.125(a)  Critical Repeat
   
Facilities, general. 
On Nov. 15, 2023, a shelf in the 1-year-old female “Kiki” the kinkajou’s enclosure became unattached, crushing and 
trapping the kinkajou underneath it. The kinkajou was transported to the attending veterinarian’s office but died of its 
injuries while in transit.  
“Ceasar”, the 5-year-old Male Bactrian camel was found dead in its pen entrapped beneath the corner of the metal sided 
shed in its enclosure around 7 am on Dec. 11, 2023. The camel had been last seen up and normal at approximately 9 pm 
the night before.  
 
Failure of structures or their components can cause injury or entrapment resulting in harm or death to the animal. Both 
indoor and outdoor housing facilities must be soundly constructed and maintained in good repair and strength to protect 
and contain the animals and to prevent injury due to their failure.

To be corrected by 2/1/2024. 
 
The death of a white wallaby joey purchased on 7/12/23 and found deceased on 7/15/23 is under review.  
 
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with facility representative.
